Your review and confirmation would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,
Reuben Thomas

Dear Reuben,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

With reference to Clause 8, which states “SoftwareOne will invoice, and Client shall pay the invoiced amounts, plus pertinent taxes, including, all applicable withholding taxes, import taxes, levies, and duties resulting from cross-border transactions (transactions where SoftwareOne and Client are tax residents of different countries). If Client is required by law to deduct or withhold any taxes from any amount payable on a cross-border transaction, the amount payable hereunder will be increased so that after making all required deductions and withholdings, SoftwareOne receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received had no such deductions or withholdings been made.”

With reference to Clause 8, which states “SoftwareOne will invoice, and Client shall pay the invoiced amounts, plus pertinent taxes, including, all applicable withholding taxes, import taxes, levies, and duties resulting from cross-border transactions (transactions where SoftwareOne and Client are tax residents of different countries). If Client is required by law to deduct or withhold any taxes from any amount payable on a cross-border transaction, the amount payable hereunder will be increased so that after making all required deductions and withholdings, SoftwareOne receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received had no such deductions or withholdings been made.” 

 

Are we accepting the gross up cost (part in bold above)? Normally, withholding tax is the cost of doing business and should be borne by the service provider (who in many countries is entitled for tax credit against their ‘home’ tax base). 

 

My recommendation would be to request direct billings to the relevant Chalhoub entities involved and to insist removing the tax gross up clause and to replace it with:

 

- Each Party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this Agreement. The Parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with the performance of this Agreement.

- Each Party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this Agreement. The Parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with the performance of this Agreement.

- In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this Agreement, the Client shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities. The Client shall provide the Service Provider with official tax receipts or certificates confirming the amount withheld. Both Parties shall cooperate to minimize any withholding tax obligation, where legally permissible, by applying for the relevant exemptions, reductions, or treaty benefits. 

 

Please let me know if you need any further details/clarifications.

 

Kind regards,

MARIEL YARD​​​​

Dear Reuben,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

With reference to Clause 8, which states “SoftwareOne will invoice, and Client shall pay the invoiced amounts, plus pertinent taxes, including, all applicable withholding taxes, import taxes, levies, and duties resulting from cross-border transactions (transactions where SoftwareOne and Client are tax residents of different countries). If Client is required by law to deduct or withhold any taxes from any amount payable on a cross-border transaction, the amount payable hereunder will be increased so that after making all required deductions and withholdings, SoftwareOne receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received had no such deductions or withholdings been made.” 

 

Are we accepting the gross up cost (part in bold above)? Normally, withholding tax is the cost of doing business and should be borne by the service provider (who in many countries is entitled for tax credit against their ‘home’ tax base). 

 

My recommendation would be to request direct billings to the relevant Chalhoub entities involved and to insist removing the tax gross up clause and to replace it with:

Are we accepting the gross up cost (part in bold above)? Normally, withholding tax is the cost of doing business and should be borne by the service provider (who in many countries is entitled for tax credit against their ‘home’ tax base). 

 

My recommendation would be to request direct billings to the relevant Chalhoub entities involved and to insist removing the tax gross up clause and to replace it with:

 

- Each Party shall be responsible for its own tax obligations and liabilities arising from the execution of this Agreement. The Parties shall take all necessary steps to comply with local tax laws, including the filing of tax returns and payment of taxes. Each Party shall bear all taxes imposed on it by law in connection with the performance of this Agreement.

- In the event that local tax regulations require the withholding of taxes on payments made under this Agreement, the Client shall withhold the required amount and remit it to the relevant tax authorities. The Client shall provide the Service Provider with official tax receipts or certificates confirming the amount withheld. Both Parties shall cooperate to minimize any withholding tax obligation, where legally permissible, by applying for the relevant exemptions, reductions, or treaty benefits. 

 

Please let me know if you need any further details/clarifications.
